pyalot.heatmap.opengl

Class Framebuffer

  • java.lang.Object
    • pyalot.heatmap.opengl.Framebuffer

  • public class Framebuffer
extends java.lang.Object

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int[] buffer
      Array which stores the generated framebuffer object names

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Framebuffer()
      Create a Framebuffer object.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      (package private) Framebuffer bind()
      Bind the framebuffer.
      (package private) Framebuffer check()
      Check the status of the framebuffer.
      (package private) Framebuffer color(Texture texture)
      Attach the given texture object as a buffer to the currently bound framebuffer object and checks errors afterwards by calling check().
      (package private) void destroy()
      Delete the framebuffer.
      (package private) Framebuffer unbind()
      Unbind the framebuffer by bind buffer zero.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        Array which stores the generated framebuffer object names

      • Framebuffer

        public Framebuffer()
        Create a Framebuffer object. The constructor generates a framebuffer.

        Delete the framebuffer.

        Bind the framebuffer.

        Framebuffer unbind()
        Unbind the framebuffer by bind buffer zero.
        Returns:
        This

      • check

        Framebuffer check()
            throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Check the status of the framebuffer. If an error occurred, an exception is thrown.
        Returns:
        This
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException

      • color

        Framebuffer color(Texture texture)
        Attach the given texture object as a buffer to the currently bound framebuffer object and checks errors afterwards by calling check().
        Parameters:
        texture - A texture
        Returns:
        This
